Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2011 12:56AM - edited Sep 23, 2011 12:58AM by bella76 I was told I was too young too, I'm 34 and I just got diagnosed. I would get a biopsy just for piece of mind. My cancer didn't show up on Ultrasound or mammogram either because younger women have dense breasts.
Posts.Title: Anyone told they're too young? jamjam29 kennessee

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2011 07:16PM bella76 wrote: Because of your age you need to have an MRI, My cancer didn't show up on ultrasound or mammogram and I was 34 at diagnosis. Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2011 01:12AM bella76 wrote: Well it's cancer, Micropapillary carcinoma. This is what the report says, Immunohistochemistry has been performed and this shows that the tumor is entirely negative for the oestrogen receptor antibody as well as the progesterone receptor antibody and shows strong (3+) positive straining for c-erb-b2 (HER-2). A characteristic membranous pattern of "inverted" straining for EMA is seen, the pattern typically associated with micropapillary carcinoma. An isolated cluster of tumor cells does appear to be within lymphatic channels (as delineated by cd31/cd34) but most of the papillary clusters are seen within retracted from the stroma as is typical for this lesion. The Ki67 proliferation index is approximately 30% If anyone can help me make some sense of this it would be greatly appreciated. I'm having my lymph node biopsy'ed tomorrow and then all the reat of the scans on thursday to complete staging. I haven't cried yet, I'm still in shock.

Posts.Title: August 2017 Surgery Group MommyErin rljes

Posts.Content: bella76 wrote: Hi everyone, My names Michelle and I've been reading up here the last few days. I'm waiting on results of a core biopsy I had done on Wednesday, taken from 4 places. I've got a 9 week old baby and had a small lump in my boob appear about a month before he was due, once my milk came in and went down the lump was much larger, it wasn't sore though. I went to the Dr's and she thought it was mastitis and put me on antibiotics, She asked if I had a fever, I didn't. The day after I started taking the antibiotics my boob started to hurt, I went back to the Dr's after a week and said I thought the lump which pretty much takes up my whole boob had gone down a little bit, The Dr disagreed with me and sent me for an ultrasound.  Ultrasound tech said most probably mastitis, went back to Dr's and she wasn't happy with that and sent me for a mammogram, mammogram showed that my right breast was denser but nothing else, also suggested mastitis. Dr wasn't happy with that so sent me to a breast specialist, went and saw her and she organised a core Biosy for me ASAP the next morning.  She didn't really give me any indication of what she thought, she just said obviously something is going on and we need to find out what it is. I'm thinking the worst obviously and think it's cancer, It's Saturday night now and i'm seeing her on Tuesday at 12pm. I'm only 34 and I'm pretty healthy, I just can't get my head around this, I don't want to leave my 3 children. Please keep me in your thoughts and send positive energy my way :(  Micropapillary BC Her+ 2011 Dx 8/2/2011, IDC, Right, 6cm+, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 8/8 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 3/5/2012 Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 3/5/2012 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right Surgery 10/19/2012 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Dx 7/7/2017, IDC, Left, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 8/10/2017 Mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Silicone implant Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2017 02:00AM bella76 wrote: got my path report from my mastectomy and SNB and I couldn't be happier. There was a 3cm lump but only the centre was IDC 1.5cm the rest was DCIS. And lymph nodes were negative! No cancer cells found. And it was grade 1 not grade 2 like the biopsy said. That's quite strange isn't it! So that means no chemotherapy and no radiotherapy! I'm so grateful and relieved.

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2011 03:58AM bella76 wrote: Hi everyone, My tumor measured approximately 10-11cm, I have been doing neoadjuvant chemo since august, I have completed 4 FEC and 2 Taxotere with Herceptin, my tumor has shrunk so much that they cann't feel where it is anymore, My Onc and Surgeon are really happy with how it has responded. I will have another MRI after the next 2 Taxotere's and Herceptin and then surgery, we haven't talked about what will happen at surgery yet.  I had 2 positive nodes at the time of diagnosis which was confirmed with a biopsy, all my other scans were clear though.
